40 setup_modules = []
41 
42 try:
43  import distutils.core
44  setup_modules.append(distutils.core)
45 except ImportError:
46  pass
47 
48 try:
49  import setuptools
50  setup_modules.append(setuptools)
51 except ImportError:
52  pass

54 assert setup_modules, 'Must have distutils or setuptools installed'

56 
57 def _get_locations(pkgs, package_dir):
58  """
59  Based on setuptools logic and the package_dir dict, builds a dict of location roots for each pkg in pkgs.
60 
61  See http://docs.python.org/distutils/setupscript.html
62 
63  :returns: a dict {pkgname: root} for each pkgname in pkgs (and each of their parents)
64  """
65  # package_dir contains a dict {package_name: relativepath}
66  # Example {'': 'src', 'foo': 'lib', 'bar': 'lib2'}
67  #
68  # '' means where to look for any package unless a parent package
69  # is listed so package bar.pot is expected at lib2/bar/pot,
70  # whereas package sup.dee is expected at src/sup/dee
71  #
72  # if package_dir does not state anything about a package,
73  # setuptool expects the package folder to be in the root of the
74  # project
75  locations = {}
76  allprefix = package_dir.get('', '')
77  for pkg in pkgs:
78  parent_location = None
79  splits = pkg.split('.')
80  # we iterate over compound name from parent to child
81  # so once we found parent, children just append to their parent
82  for key_len in range(len(splits)):
83  key = '.'.join(splits[:key_len + 1])
84  if key not in locations:
85  if key in package_dir:
86  locations[key] = package_dir[key]
87  elif parent_location is not None:
88  locations[key] = os.path.join(parent_location, splits[key_len])
89  else:
90  locations[key] = os.path.join(allprefix, key)
91  parent_location = locations[key]
92  return locations
93 
94 
95 def generate_cmake_file(package_name, version, scripts, package_dir, pkgs, modules, setup_module=None):
96  """
97  Generate lines to add to a cmake file which will set variables.
98 
99  :param version: str, format 'int.int.int'
100  :param scripts: [list of str]: relative paths to scripts
101  :param package_dir: {modulename: path}
102  :param pkgs: [list of str] python_packages declared in catkin package
103  :param modules: [list of str] python modules
104  :param setup_module: str, setuptools or distutils
105  """
106  prefix = '%s_SETUP_PY' % package_name
107  result = []
108  if setup_module:
109  result.append(r'set(%s_SETUP_MODULE "%s")' % (prefix, setup_module))
110  result.append(r'set(%s_VERSION "%s")' % (prefix, version))
111  result.append(r'set(%s_SCRIPTS "%s")' % (prefix, ';'.join(scripts)))
112 
113  # Remove packages with '.' separators.
114  #
115  # setuptools allows specifying submodules in other folders than
116  # their parent
117  #
118  # The symlink approach of catkin does not work with such submodules.
119  # In the common case, this does not matter as the submodule is
120  # within the containing module. We verify this assumption, and if
121  # it passes, we remove submodule packages.
122  locations = _get_locations(pkgs, package_dir)
123  for pkgname, location in locations.items():
124  if '.' not in pkgname:
125  continue
126  splits = pkgname.split('.')
127  # hack: ignore write-combining setup.py files for msg and srv files
128  if splits[1] in ['msg', 'srv']:
129  continue
130  # check every child has the same root folder as its parent
131  root_name = splits[0]
132  root_location = location
133  for _ in range(len(splits) - 1):
134  root_location = os.path.dirname(root_location)
135  if root_location != locations[root_name]:
136  raise RuntimeError(
137  'catkin_export_python does not support setup.py files that combine across multiple directories: %s in %s, %s in %s' % (pkgname, location, root_name, locations[root_name]))
138 
139  # If checks pass, remove all submodules
140  pkgs = [p for p in pkgs if '.' not in p]
141 
142  resolved_pkgs = []
143  for pkg in pkgs:
144  resolved_pkgs += [locations[pkg]]
145 
146  result.append(r'set(%s_PACKAGES "%s")' % (prefix, ';'.join(pkgs)))
147  result.append(r'set(%s_PACKAGE_DIRS "%s")' % (prefix, ';'.join(resolved_pkgs).replace('\\', '/')))
148 
149  # skip modules which collide with package names
150  filtered_modules = []
151  for modname in modules:
152  splits = modname.split('.')
153  # check all parents too
154  equals_package = [('.'.join(splits[:-i]) in locations) for i in range(len(splits))]
155  if any(equals_package):
156  continue
157  filtered_modules.append(modname)
158  module_locations = _get_locations(filtered_modules, package_dir)
159 
160  result.append(r'set(%s_MODULES "%s")' % (prefix, ';'.join(['%s.py' % m.replace('.', '/') for m in filtered_modules])))
161  result.append(r'set(%s_MODULE_DIRS "%s")' % (prefix, ';'.join([module_locations[m] for m in filtered_modules]).replace('\\', '/')))
162 
163  return result
164 
165 
166 def _create_mock_setup_function(setup_module, package_name, outfile):
167  """
168  Create a function to call instead of distutils.core.setup or setuptools.setup.
169 
170  It just captures some args and writes them into a file that can be used from cmake.
171 
172  :param package_name: name of the package
173  :param outfile: filename that cmake will use afterwards
174  :returns: a function to replace disutils.core.setup and setuptools.setup
175  """
176 
177  def setup(*args, **kwargs):
178  """Check kwargs and write a scriptfile."""
179  if 'version' not in kwargs:
180  sys.stderr.write("\n*** Unable to find 'version' in setup.py of %s\n" % package_name)
181  raise RuntimeError('version not found in setup.py')
182  version = kwargs['version']
183  package_dir = kwargs.get('package_dir', {})
184 
185  pkgs = kwargs.get('packages', [])
186  scripts = kwargs.get('scripts', [])
187  modules = kwargs.get('py_modules', [])
188 
189  unsupported_args = [
190  'entry_points',
191  'exclude_package_data',
192  'ext_modules ',
193  'ext_package',
194  'include_package_data',
195  'namespace_packages',
196  'setup_requires',
197  'use_2to3',
198  'zip_safe']
199  used_unsupported_args = [arg for arg in unsupported_args if arg in kwargs]
200  if used_unsupported_args:
201  sys.stderr.write('*** Arguments %s to setup() not supported in catkin devel space in setup.py of %s\n' % (used_unsupported_args, package_name))
202 
203  result = generate_cmake_file(package_name=package_name,
204  version=version,
205  scripts=scripts,
206  package_dir=package_dir,
207  pkgs=pkgs,
208  modules=modules,
209  setup_module=setup_module)
210  with open(outfile, 'w') as out:
211  out.write('\n'.join(result))
212 
213  return setup
214 
215 
216 def main():
217  """Script main, parses arguments and invokes Dummy.setup indirectly."""
218  parser = ArgumentParser(description='Utility to read setup.py values from cmake macros. Creates a file with CMake set commands setting variables.')
219  parser.add_argument('package_name', help='Name of catkin package')
220  parser.add_argument('setupfile_path', help='Full path to setup.py')
221  parser.add_argument('outfile', help='Where to write result to')
222 
223  args = parser.parse_args()
224 
225  # print("%s" % sys.argv)
226  # PACKAGE_NAME = sys.argv[1]
227  # OUTFILE = sys.argv[3]
228  # print("Interrogating setup.py for package %s into %s " % (PACKAGE_NAME, OUTFILE),
229  # file=sys.stderr)
230 
231  # print("executing %s" % args.setupfile_path)
232 
233  # be sure you're in the directory containing
234  # setup.py so the sys.path manipulation works,
235  # so the import of __version__ works
236  os.chdir(os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(args.setupfile_path)))
237 
238  # patch setup() function of distutils and setuptools for the
239  # context of evaluating setup.py
240  backup_modules = {}
241  try:
242 
243  for module in setup_modules:
244  backup_modules[id(module)] = module.setup
245  module.setup = _create_mock_setup_function(
246  setup_module=module.__name__, package_name=args.package_name, outfile=args.outfile)
247 
248  runpy.run_path(args.setupfile_path)
249  finally:
250  for module in setup_modules:
251  module.setup = backup_modules[id(module)]
252 
253 
254 if __name__ == '__main__':
255  main()
